article.headline: Portland St. 93, Linfield 50
article.story: PORTLAND, Ore. (AP) -- Deonte Huff and Dupree Lucas scored 14 points apiece to lead Portland State to a 93-50 victory over Linfield on Tuesday. Scott Morrison added 13 points and 10 rebounds for Portland State (3-2), and Jeremiah Dominguez had 11 points and seven assists. K.C. Wiser led Linfield (2-1) with 10 points. Portland State, which never trailed, broke open a tight game midway through the first half. Tyrell Mara capped a 13-1 run with a 3-pointer that put the Vikings up 30-16 with 6:48 left in the half. The Vikings closed out the half with three 3-pointers in the final three minutes and led the Division III Wildcats 47-26 at the break. Linfield never challenged in the second half. Portland shot 47 percent from the floor and held Linfield to 28 percent. Portland State also dominated its lower-division foe in the paint, outscoring the Wildcats 42-20 and outrebounding them 51-34.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
